titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Benjamin Brubaker papers, 1844-1861
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Official papers of Benjamin Brubaker. The earliest letter is family correspondence sent to Brubaker from relatives in Indiana. Two later letters are official documents from the Confederate States of America government issued for the purpose of sequestering certain properties of Jacob Brubaker, a resident of Indiana and a considered to be an enemy alien, through his agent, Benjamin Brubaker.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Benjamin Brubaker Papers, 1844-1861, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Official papers of Benjamin Brubaker. The earliest letter is family correspondence sent to Brubaker from relatives in Indiana. Two later letters are official documents from the Confederate States of America government issued for the purpose of sequestering certain properties of Jacob Brubaker, a resident of Indiana and a considered to be an enemy alien, through his agent, Benjamin Brubaker.
